image.altText: A flag on a for sale sign outside a house

items.synopsis: The latest data published by the Office of the Valuer-General shows the median house price in South Australia has reached $700,000, rising by 5.2 per cent in the past year.

title.children: Median sale price of houses in metropolitan Adelaide reaches $700k

image.altText: A woman holds Australian flags at a soccer match.

items.synopsis: Three suitable donors have been found during an urgent nationwide search for an Adelaide mother with a rare blood type in need of life-saving heart surgery.

title.children: Three donors found in urgent nationwide search to save Adelaide mother with rare blood type, but more needed

image.altText: a man in hi vis coat and a woman in black coat , leaning on fence looking across the farm

items.synopsis: The majority of fatalities on Australian farms are attributed to farm vehicles or mobile farm machinery.

title.children: Lindy's harvest accident highlights the farm safety issues the agriculture sector struggles to deal with

image.altText: A teenage boy with short hair wearing a grey hoodie gazes into the camera.

items.synopsis: Gymnast Josh was training for 14 hours a week until two bad falls set him off course. After the teen suffered debilitating brain fog, dizziness and trouble focusing, his mother says getting the right concussion diagnosis and treatment was a "gruelling" process.

title.children: Josh didn't black out when he hit his head. Weeks later, he got worried

image.altText: A ship pulls Taipan wreckage from the ocean, authorities are in a smaller watercraft nearby

items.synopsis: Police say wreckage found off the Queensland coast appears to be from missing Taipan chopper, but the search continues for its four-person crew.

title.children: Authorities recover likely Army chopper wreckage, four crew still missing

image.altText: A tall Swedish player rises to head the ball past the goalkeeper into the Italian net.

items.synopsis: Sweden blow the game open in Wellington with a brilliant six minute burst against Italy in Group G, later France needing a win against a confident Brazil. Follow live.

title.children: Sweden strike hard late in first half against Italy in Wellington at Women's World Cup

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Incredible gear change late in the half from Sweden, as they pummel Italy with three goals in the space of six minutes.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: HALF-TIME: Sweden 3 - 0 Italy

children.content: Incredible gear change late in the half from Sweden, as they pummel Italy with three goals in the space of six minutes.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Too easy for the Swedes. From the resulting corner, the ball is not dealt with and bounces to Rolfo at the back post, she gets a knee to it and it's over the line!
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: 44' GOOOAAL Sweden! That's 2-0

children.content: Too easy for the Swedes. From the resulting corner, the ball is not dealt with and bounces to Rolfo at the back post, she gets a knee to it and it's over the line!

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: The corner was perfect and the centre back Amanda Ilestedt is there to head it home - just as she did in the last game. Huge leap and she was well positioned just in front of the keeper. 1-0 to Sweden! Deserved lead, Sweden have taken control of this one.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: 39' GOAAAAAAAL Sweden!

children.content: The corner was perfect and the centre back Amanda Ilestedt is there to head it home - just as she did in the last game.
Huge leap and she was well positioned just in front of the keeper.
Deserved lead, Sweden have taken control of this one.

image.altText: Matildas fans outside stadium.

items.synopsis: Aussie crowds have been wonderful during the Women's World Cup, showing up in numbers with passionate and knowledgeable support. There's just one thing missing, writes Dan Colasimone.

title.children: The Women's World Cup is proving once again that Australian crowds need some new chants

image.altText: Albanese stands speaking to media from a courtyard.

items.synopsis: Anthony Albanese has signalled a return to a sharper political contest with his announcement that the government would be reintroducing the legislation for its Housing Australia Future Fund next week, writes Laura Tingle.

title.children: With a possible double dissolution, Albanese has an exceptionally rare opportunity

image.altText: A sign saying CORONERS COURT on a modern sandstone building

items.synopsis: The inquest heard that the mother's heart rate was monitored instead of the baby's for nearly 30 minutes. It also heard the most senior doctor rostered on that night was a first-year obstetrics registrar who didn't have experience in handling a complicated urgent assisted delivery.

title.children: 'Fundamental and tragic error': Baby's death at Adelaide hospital could have been prevented, coroner finds

image.altText: The logo of Greyhound Racing SA on a wall.

items.synopsis: Greyhound Racing SA lays 12 charges against two registered industry participants following reports by the ABC about alleged animal mistreatment.

title.children: Two people charged with greyhound mistreatment following ABC report

image.altText: A young blonde woman wearing a red robe with white fluffy collar and sleeves smiles in front of people on red leather couches

items.synopsis: Dressed in an ermine-trimmed red robe, Charlotte Owen was sworn in as the newest baroness in the House of Lords. But her appointment has sparked a debate about the state of British democracy.

title.children: This 30yo just became the UK's youngest baroness. Critics say she's Boris Johnson's 'final act of madness'

image.altText: Sam Kerr looks to her left as she watches the Matildas warm up for their World Cup match against Nigeria.

items.synopsis: Matildas captain Sam Kerr declares herself fit to return from injury for Australia's huge Women's World Cup match against Canada.

title.children: Sam Kerr available for Matildas' crucial World Cup clash against Canada

image.altText: Trump in front of a US flag, raising his fist

items.synopsis: Donald Trump has been charged after trying and failing to delete CCTV evidence of farcical and allegedly criminal behaviour. How was he brought undone by a bunch of boxes?

title.children: Donald Trump was just charged with deleting CCTV footage. Could it land him in jail?

image.altText: A headshot of a young woman with blonde hair looking off camera.

items.synopsis: A NSW Police cadaver dog brought into Tasmania to help with the search for Shyanne-Lee Tatnell is repurposed to look for missing Belgian tourist Celine Cremer, following new information.

title.children: New lead on missing Belgian tourist's phone activity helps pinpoint search

image.altText: An orthodox priest conducts a ceremony in a gilded church with two men in silver robes standing each side of him

items.synopsis: Ukraine moves its official Christmas holiday to December 25 in a break with the Russian Orthodox Church which celebrates it on January 7.

title.children: Ukraine moves Christmas holiday, distancing itself from Russian tradition

image.altText: A close up image of a baby breastfeeding.

items.synopsis: It's natural to worry about the safety of children, but it seems there are real dangers, confected dangers and also concerns about dangers that only seem to exist for one small group of kids who all have mums that have travelled a similar path, writes Virginia Trioli.

title.children: Millions of Australian children live in real danger every day, but they are rarely the subject of Twitter outrage

image.altText: STeve Smith dives

items.synopsis: Joe Root takes a mind-bending catch, while Steve Smith survives the tightest of run-out decisions as Australia battles hard on day two of the fifth Ashes Test at The Oval. Here are five things you missed overnight.

title.children: Five quick hits — Steve Smith's great run-out escape and Joe Root's stunning catch

image.altText: Two eggs boil in water in a red saucepan on a stainless steel gas cooktop with a black patterned tile splashback

items.synopsis: "It's no longer plentiful, it's no longer cheap and it's also a fossil fuel." Why the Victorian government is pushing people to ditch gas.

title.children: Australia's most gas-dependent state is being forced to phase it out. Why? Will other states follow?

image.altText: A composite image of a two women and a man outdoors. They are caucasian, wearing smart casual, and political candidates.

items.synopsis: WA voters decide who will replace former premier Mark McGowan in the safe Labor seat in Perth's south, in what is also an early test for new Premier Roger Cook.

title.children: Premier expects 'tight' race in Rockingham to replace Mark McGowan despite huge swing

image.altText: Smoke rises above military vehicles during Taiwan military drills.

items.synopsis: The US announces millions of dollars in military aid for Taiwan, in what is the Biden administration's first major package drawing on America's current weapons stockpiles to help Taipei counter China.

title.children: US announces $519m weapons package for Taiwan

image.altText: You view a young Filipina leaning against a vintage red sedan, as green rolling hills stretch out behind her to the horizon.

items.synopsis: Migrations don't just happen, they're produced. It's a thread Alan Weedon followed as he retraced his mum Jesusita's story after her death.

title.children: 'Do you have a sister?' How Filipina women have battled the mail-order bride stereotype

image.altText: Floral bouquet and Shyanne-Lee Tatnell composite image.

items.synopsis: Flowers, teddy bears and ribbons are being left near where 14-year-old Shyanne-Lee Tatnell was last seen — as the teen's grandmother thanks Tasmanians for their support and "beautiful gesture".

title.children: 'Horrific time': Shyanne-Lee's grandmother thanks community amid grief over 14yo's alleged murder

image.altText: Linda Caicedo kicking a ball.

items.synopsis: Colombia gives an update on teen sensation Linda Caicedo after a training incident, while France prepares to make a call on its injured captain ahead of its clash with Brazil — these are five talking points at the Women's World Cup as day eight takes centre stage.

title.children: Five quick hits — concern for young Colombian star as France, England deal with injury woes

image.altText: Steve Smith holds his bat as he walks towards the middle

items.synopsis: A long Ashes series is approaching its conclusion, but on a day where the Australians could have seen the fifth Test slip away entirely, they proved there is still fight in their weary legs.

title.children: A weary Australia is limping towards the Ashes finish line, but a spirited fightback has kept it alive

image.altText: A photo of the Indigenous flag outside a council building.

items.synopsis: The wording references "all Aboriginal communities", with one councillor saying she did not want to honour "all members" of any community.

title.children: WA councillor stands by 'offensive' acknowledgement of country comments

image.altText: Ben King

items.synopsis: The Gold Coast Suns are taking it up to the Brisbane Lions, after Geelong and the Western Bulldogs copped damaging losses earlier in the day. Follow our live AFL ScoreCentre for all the scores, stats and results.

title.children: AFL live: Suns look to continue day of upsets after Cats and Dogs take finals hope hits

image.altText: A woman with silver hair and glasses smiles at the camera

items.synopsis: Shirley Newton captures the beauty of the Wimmera-Mallee region with her hundreds of landscapes and still-life paintings.

title.children: Shirley was in her 60s when she first picked up a paintbrush. Now — at 92 — she's holding her first solo exhibition

image.altText: A car on fire with flashing lights seen through the mist of smoke, and numbered evidence markers on the road

items.synopsis: Police knew when Alen Moradian was shot dead a month ago that Sydney's gangland could explode. After a week of violence, they say it is all about control of drug trade in the city.

title.children: 'We know for a fact what's behind it all': The common thread linking Sydney's gangland shootings

image.altText: Man sitting on chair in an office with purple lighting, hands apart, talking into a microphone and looking towards a camera.

items.synopsis: Trying to make something that works as both a podcast and a TV show has been tried before — and failed. But the ABC's If You're Listening podcast team is testing that theory.

title.children: How do you make a podcast interesting to watch?

image.altText: Two Australian players embrace as they celebrate a century against Ireland in the women's ODI.

items.synopsis: Missing several of its well-established stars, Australia completes a 2-0 ODI series victory against Ireland, with openers Annabel Sutherland and Phoebe Litchfield scoring unbeaten centuries.

title.children: Sutherland, Litchfield lead young Aussie brigade to ODI win over Ireland

image.altText: An empty beach with Cape Byron in the background.

items.synopsis: There are fears Byron Bay's time in the sun has come to an end as the North Coast Tourism Symposium hears annual visitor numbers have dropped by one million since 2019.

title.children: Byron Bay suffering a 'sting in the tail' as annual visitor numbers fall by one million since 2019

image.altText: a woman looks at the destruction caused after a bushfire burnt down her home

items.synopsis: Recent wildfires across the Mediterranean coupled with warnings of El Niño and Earth's hottest month on record have raised questions about what's ahead for Australia's bushfire season.

title.children: Why a repeat of Black Summer is unlikely this fire season despite El Niño warnings

image.altText: Band of Royal Military College at Chinese Embassy.

items.synopsis: A decision to allow the Royal Military Band to perform at a People's Liberation Army celebration in Canberra this week is criticised by veterans and the federal opposition.

title.children: Australian military band's Chinese embassy performance hits wrong note with diggers

image.altText: Members of the Ukrainian Navy fire a gun during naval drills on a ship.

items.synopsis: With no naval fleet, Kyiv has been relying on sea drone technology and land-launched missiles to push back Moscow's maritime power. As Black Sea tensions simmer, will this continue to be enough?

title.children: Ukraine 'doesn't have a navy', while Russia has 'the lot'. Can innovation beat big ships in the Black Sea battle?

image.altText: A rusted piece of metal rigging protrudes from the beach sand.

items.synopsis: Beneath metres of sand at Inverloch the Amazon, one of Victoria's best-preserved shipwrecks, still has stories to tell but concerns are growing about the effect of erosion and the pounding sea.

title.children: 160 years after Amazon's demise, she's giving up secrets from her beach grave
